alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 1:46PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Increased snow melt and reservoir releases will produce high river flows. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Mainstem Walker River...including PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases is ongoing. * WHERE...Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, minor to moderate flooding below Weber Reservoir impacting agricultural land and access roads. Riverbank instablilty may cause additional impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:25 PM PDT Friday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:25 PM PDT Friday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood stage is 17.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when camping or hiking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon.
